comments.content:
To anyone reading later on this is why DS-Lite and MAP-T should be swapped. https://support.huawei.com/enterprise/en/doc/EDOC1100055124/a58d0f0b/basic-map-t-map-e-architecture

Some good MAP-T / MAP-E resources are also:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7597 & https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7599

Agree with the swap.
"The Mapping of Address and Port Using Translation feature provides connectivity to IPv4 hosts across IPv6 domains. Mapping of address and port using translation (MAP-T) is a mechanism that performs double translation (IPv4 to IPv6 and vice versa) on customer edge (CE) devices and border routers."

"The DS-Lite architecture uses IPv6-only links between the provider and the customer while maintaining the IPv4 (or dual-stack) hosts in the customer network.
When a customer’s device sends an IPv4 packet to an external destination, the IPv4 packet is encapsulated in an IPv6 packet for transport into the provider network. "

discussion.content: I think DS-Lite and MAP-T should be swapped.

comments.content: Correct source. So we need to swap MAP-T/Ds Lite

discussion.content:
https://www.ciscolive.com/c/dam/r/ciscolive/emea/docs/2018/pdf/BRKSPG-2602.pdf.
on page 60 , its mentioned that DS-lite requires and ipv6 access network. so one can say that original answer is true. no need to SWAP.

Mapping of Address and Port using Translation (MAP-T), MAP-T uses NAT64 to translate IPv4 to IPv6 and back. because this translates ipv4 to ipv6, it more made sense to me it will require "ipv6 access network"
https://blogs.cisco.com/sp/a-map-to-easier-more-scalable-ipv6-deployments
Agree, DSLite / MAP-T should be swapped

questions.question_text: How much must the MTU be increased when configuring the 802.1q VLAN tag?

Egress PE NAT is being used via a single centralized router to provide Internet access to L3VPN customers.
Which description of the NAT operation is true?

choices.D: Users in different VRFs cannot share the same outside global IP address.
choices.C: The different L3VPNs using the Internet access must not have IP overlaps internally.
choices.A: The NAT table contains a field to identify the inside VRF of a translation.
choices.B: Multiple address pools are needed for the same L3VPN because each site has a separate NAT.

discussion.content:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/network-address-translation-nat/112084-ios-nat-mpls-vpn-00.html

In order for devices in multiple VPNs that have overlapping address schemes to access a shared service host, NAT is required. When NAT is configured at the egress PE, [the network address translation table entries will include a VRF identifier to differentiate duplicate addresses] and ensure proper routing.

comments.content: thank you for going above and beyond on this explanation! we need more people like you :)

choices.C: The switch port passively negotiates an EtherChannel if it receives PAgP packets from a connected peer.
choices.D: The switch port accepts LACP and PAgP packets from a connected peer and negotiate an EtherChannel using the common EtherChannel mode.
choices.B: The switch port actively sends packets to negotiate an EtherChannel using PAgP.
choices.A: The switch port negotiates an EtherChannel if it receives LACP packets from a connected peer running passive mode.

discussion.content:
https://www.grandmetric.com/knowledge-base/design_and_configure/how-to-configure-cisco-pagp/

Auto mode: it passively negotiates PAgP aggregation. If the remote end of the link is also configured with Auto mode, a PAgP EtherChannel will not form. Auto side is waiting for negotiation to start from the other end.
Desirable mode:that actively negotiates PAgP. The remote end must be configured in Auto or Desirable mode for a PAgP EtherChannel to form.

comments.content: My Boi terebok killing it with the explanations!

discussion.content: desirable —Unconditionally enables PAgP. It places the port into an active negotiating state, in which the port starts negotiations with other ports by sending PAgP packets. This keyword is not supported when EtherChannel members are from different switches in the switch stack.
